result.execSummary:
The defendant Markus Adam Rydeen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Bond discharged once Defendant signs up for Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
DNA Sample and surcharge.
Payable through Probation.

-Maintain current mental health including medications.
-Subject to random and regular testing.
-Assessment for Domestic Violence.
-No Abusive Contact with Stephanie Schwan.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Markus Adam Rydeen appeared from jail. Includes plea in 13CF316 and arraignment in 14CF79. ADA Nieskes informs Crt of agreement. ADA Nieskes does not object expungement. Victims rights have been complied with. DE pleads no contest to Amended Ct 3 - Misdemeanor Battery without domestic enhancer in 13CF316 and no contest Amended Ct 1 Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor in 14CF79. Attorneys stipulate to the complaint. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty to Amended Ct 3 -Misdemeanor Battery without domestic enhancer in 13CF316 and guilty to Amended Ct 1 Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor in 14CF79. On motion of State, Crt dismisses without prejudice, Cts 1, 2, 4 and 5. Recommendations. DE makes statement:  Crt orders:  Sentence:  W/H 1 year probation. Concurrent on each count but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.  Conditions of probation are: 

-AODA and any follow through as recommended.
-Maintain current mental health including medications.
-Random and regular testing.
-Assement for domestic violence.
-No abusive contact with Stephanie Schwan.
Credit for 18 days. Court modifies bonds to signature. kes
filed by ADA Correll. kjf
